item.title: EGX and The Death of the UK Gaming Expo
item.content:encoded:
The United Kingdom‚Äôs relationship with the video game expo scene has crumbled. Once upon a time, the nation boasted showcases like the Insomnia Gaming Festival, WASD, and EGX, but they‚Äôve all disappeared into the shadows over the years.

The Insomnia Gaming Festival went bust (and is trying a half-hearted resurgence), WASD shut down, and EGX has become a pitiful, almost unbranded corner in the larger MCM Comic Con in London. I attended EGX over the weekend, and I‚Äôm sad to say that it‚Äôs no longer worth keeping alive.

EGX‚Äôs disappearance marks the death of the UK gaming expo circuit.

UK Gamers Are Left to Dream(Hack)

Next year, DreamHack returns to the United Kingdom for the first time in ten years, which is a saving grace of sorts for gamers across the territory. In some places, the courageous efforts of more grassroots events like EPIC.LAN are trying to get some wheels turning, but the most iconic expos in the business have now faded into nothingness.

In 2024, the Insomnia Gaming Festival imploded after 25 years of entertaining visitors, thanks to financial woes brought on by the lingering impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. It‚Äôs trying to make a grand return in 2025, but it‚Äôs not looking good.

Also in 2024, the WASD showcase, a more intimate event in London that was one of my favorite events in the world, was shut down as the event‚Äôs organiser entered liquidation.

Now, I‚Äôm sad to report that EGX is done and dusted.

Farewell, EGX

Formerly known as the Eurogamer Expo, EGX was once the shining star of the UK gaming scene, a monumental event that drew international acclaim and hosted a showfloor featuring the biggest names in the business.

The COVID-19 pandemic wasn‚Äôt kind to EGX, but in the years that followed the devastation of the virus, EGX seemed to be getting back on an even keel. That growth has ebbed away into nothing, and EGX is now an unrecognizable corner of the larger MCM Comic Con event.

I attended EGX (for the last time) this year, and baulked at what was on display. It was almost impossible to spot any EGX branding, and what I did find was a few scattered indie games and a lone LAN area featuring a few rigs with a mix of playable titles on them. No big names, no exclusive demo opportunities, and almost nothing in the way of gaming activations.

In 2024, EGX and MCM joined forces, but the showcases were separated, and EGX still enjoyed a standalone profile that was represented in the branding of the event. This year, EGX has all but disappeared, leaving MCM standing tall ‚Äì but even that has issues.

As I walked around MCM, I was greeted by vast swathes of market-style stalls selling anime body pillow covers, mystery bags, animatronic furry tails, AI-generated art prints, and plastic toys aplenty. Amid a sea of half-baked cosplays and bored-looking event employees, I found none of my people; the gamers had failed to show out for EGX, what little of it there was.

Barely an Expo

The PR folks backing the event were offering me nothing but film and TV opportunities, and despite there being the likes of Troy Baker, Ben Starr, Chris Judge, Doug Cockle, Neil Newbon, and Elias Toufexis in attendance, nothing came up in a gaming capacity.

I made a conscious effort to request some kind of connection from the staff running the meet and greet area, and was palmed off with a ‚ÄòSorry, they don‚Äôt have time for that,‚Äô by a go-between messenger of an employee who failed to get me any traction from a nearby manager. I should stress that the manager who had ‚Äòno time‚Äô for me was plainly standing on the spot doing nothing.

With no games to play, no big-named exhibitors occupying the show floor, and there being nothing in the way of gaming activations, I was reduced to wandering the stalls and trying to get excited about merchandise (spoiler alert: I didn‚Äôt).

The panels were visited by a half dozen people every time someone was on the stage, the security staff were lacklustre and weren‚Äôt doing their job properly, and the busiest portion of the event seemed to always be the ‚Äòfood court‚Äô.

I can see EGX vanishing entirely next year, and while MCM will persist, it too has been reduced to something almost unworthy of a spot in your calendar. All eyes are now on Gamescom, an utterly phenomenal event that continues to expand year after year. I‚Äôve been to Gamescom twice and can stress that it‚Äôs the ultimate event in the world for gamers, and I just praise that it‚Äôs only a short flight away for me.

Elsewhere, gamers around the world can still enjoy events like Summer Game Fest, PAX, DreamHack, Tokyo Game Show, and other localized, regional events. If you want a regular expo in the UK, you‚Äôre out of luck and will need to travel.

Do you agree that the United Kingdom needs to do better in the gaming space? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Today‚Äôs Wordle #1591: Hints And Answer For October 27, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Get ready for an easier Wordle answer than the past few days. Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a daily player, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak‚Äîif you‚Äôre open to a little extra help. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Wordle, don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1591 for October 27, 2025.

To play today‚Äôs Wordle, head to the game‚Äôs website. If you want to go right to today‚Äôs answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you‚Äôve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs and yesterday‚Äôs editions of Wordle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 27, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1591 ups the difficulty from Sunday‚Äôs puzzle. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today‚Äôs answer takes an average of 4.6 guesses out of 6 to get. That means it‚Äôs the same as the 4.2-guess average on October 26.

General Wordle Hints For October 27

Without giving today‚Äôs Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains two different vowels.
  • Hint 2: It starts with F.
  • Hint 3: It describes something unpleasant to the nose.
  • Hint 4: It means foul-smelling. Think rotten or rancid.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1591 for October 27, 2025

Starter Words For October 27, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • DEFTS
  • FIRED
  • TIDED

Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer For Game #1591 On October 27, 2025

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today‚Äôs Wordle below.

Answer: FETID

If you solved today‚Äôs Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday‚Äôs Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here‚Äôs yesterday‚Äôs Wordle answer for Game #1590 on October 26, 2025:

Answer: PLUMP

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1591?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 28 will be Wordle Game #1592.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn‚Äôt fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you‚Äôd like tips and clues for in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Poll: Box Art Brawl - Duel: Metroid Prime 2: Echoes
item.content:encoded:
Interest-Ing

Hello hello, and welcome to another edition of Box Art Brawl!

Last time, we looked at Hey You, Pikachu! for the N64, and although neither version was particularly popular, it was the North American version that won the day with 61% of the vote.

This week, we're back with the Metroid franchise with Metroid Prime 2: Echoes, the excellent GameCube follow-up to the Retro Studios original. Released in 2004, it introduced the now-iconic Dark Samus to the series while showcasing an awesome dual-world environment in which a deadly species known as the 'Ing' attack Samus and rob her of her core abilities.

Overall reception was positive, with many praising its continued gameplay and intriguing storyline, though some criticism was made toward the game's high difficulty and limited multiplayer mode.

Its the west vs. Japan this week, so let's get to it!

North America / Europe

We're all familiar with this one, right? It showcases Samus in a pretty cool action pose, while in the top left, we can see U-Mos, the last remaining Luminoth on the planet Aether. In the bottom right, meanwhile, we can just about make out the Ing, and this makes for a lovely little representation of the light and dark shifts we see in the game. Lovely stuff.

Japan

Japan's approach is interesting, not least because it contains an odd little release date advertisement over on the right. Why..? Who knows. Otherwise, this is mostly a showcase of Samus herself, however the change in colours as we move toward the right indicate the encroaching presence of Dark Samus.

Oh, and it's also called 'Dark Echoes' here, for reasons!

Thanks for voting! We'll see you next time for another Box Art Brawl.

Nintendo Life‚Äôs resident horror fanatic, when he‚Äôs not knee-deep in Resident Evil and Silent Hill lore, Ollie likes to dive into a good horror book while nursing a lovely cup of tea. He also enjoys long walks and listens to everything from TOOL to Chuck Berry.

item.title: Street Fighter 6 McDonald's EX Colours Now Available, Here's Every Free Code
item.content:encoded:
Give Ryu, Chun-Li and Ken a new look

McDonald's Japan recently teamed up with Capcom's Street Fighter series to offer a new range of burgers.

If you're not able to make it to Japan in time to taste test each one, this might be the next best thing. The global fast food restaurant is now offering free codes for Street Fighter 6 which unlock "McDonald's EX" colours for certain characters. This includes different colours for select Ryu, Chun-Li and Ken outfits.

And here's each code via the McDonald's Japan social media account. To unlock each colour in the game, you'll need to navigate to the options menu and scroll down to "Input event code". From there, you can redeem each outfit colour.

McDonald's EX Colour (Ryu)

  • M3L4-WJAK-8FCH-6AYV

McDonald's EX Colour (Chun-Li)

  • CDU9-BBPC-DNQU-98M9

McDonald's EX Colour (Ken)

  • LFCU-8RYT-7MP9-RH8F

Nintendo Life can confirm these codes can be redeemed in local copies of Street Fighter 6 on Switch 2. You can redeem these codes on other platforms as well. Just keep in mind, to access these colours, you'll need to have unlocked or purchased the specific outfit for each character.

These codes can be redeemed until 12th December 2025. There's also a McDonald's EX colour for M.Bison, but this is apparently a gift region-locked to Japan.

Street Fighter 6 arrived alongside the Switch 2 in June. You can find out more about it in our review here on Nintendo Life.

Will you be grabbing any of these McDonald's themed colours while they're available? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: Halo: Campaign Evolved Announced for Xbox, PC, and Yes, PS5 ‚Äì Here‚Äôs Everything We Know So Far, Including New Missions
item.content:encoded:
Microsoft and Halo Studios have just announced Halo: Campaign Evolved, an Unreal Engine 5 remake of the 2001 original-Xbox launch-day classic, Halo: Combat Evolved. I played a short demo of it already, so be sure to check out my first impressions, but here we‚Äôll go through everything we do and don‚Äôt yet know about 2026‚Äôs Halo release ‚Äì which will be the first one since 2021‚Äôs Halo Infinite.

Did you say ‚Äúremake‚Äù?

Yes, I asked Halo Studios point-blank if this is a remake or a remaster, and Executive Producer Damon Conn said, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a modernized remake ‚Äì a rebuilt version of the classic story that started it all.‚Äù

Halo: Campaign Evolved ‚Äì First Screenshots

Since Microsoft has been publishing a lot of games on other platforms, does this mean Halo will be coming to PlayStation 5?

Yes, Halo: Campaign Evolved will be released for Xbox Series X|S, PC, and PS5. And yes, I did clarify with Halo Studios that the PS5 version will be released day-and-date with the Xbox and PC versions.

Is this weirder than Sonic games coming to Nintendo consoles?

It‚Äôs at least on that same level of weird, yeah.

Is Halo Studios adding any PS5 Pro enhancements?

I asked this question, and Game Director Greg Hermann didn‚Äôt say much, only telling me, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs safe to say that it will be tuned for the target devices.‚Äù

OK, so when will Halo: Campaign Evolved be released?

So far, all Halo Studios will say is ‚Äú2026,‚Äù but it seems highly likely that it will be released close to the 25th anniversary of Combat Evolved‚Äôs release, which will be on November 16, 2026. In other words, Fall 2026 seems like a safe bet.

Campaign Evolved? Does that mean there‚Äôs no multiplayer?

Sort of. There is campaign co-op for two players in split-screen, or up to four players online. Cross-play is supported.

Wait, cross-play? Does that mean I can play co-op with a friend who‚Äôs on PS5 while I‚Äôm on Xbox or PC?

Yup.

Finish the multiplayer thought. What do you mean by ‚Äúsort of‚Äù with multiplayer?

As the name suggests, this is campaign-only. When I asked about why they‚Äôre not also remaking Halo 1‚Äôs fantastic multiplayer in Unreal Engine 5 ‚Äì think about how glorious Blood Gulch and Hang ‚ÄòEm High and Sidewinder would look in UE5! ‚Äì Game Director Greg Hermann told me, ‚ÄúRight now we‚Äôre just focused on the 25th anniversary and the campaign here.‚Äù Executive Producer Damon Conn added, ‚ÄúHalo Infinite and [Halo: The Master Chief Collection] provide really great experiences for multiplayer.‚Äù Which is true‚Ä¶though that doesn‚Äôt help PS5 owners very much. Unless‚Ä¶

Does this pave the way for Halo: The Master Chief Collection and Halo Infinite to get ported to PS5 to get PlayStation players caught up on the series?

We‚Äôll have to check back on that one. Conn said, ‚ÄúThere is an opportunity for us to grow the fanbase. We‚Äôre bringing the most players to Halo ever. So that growth is what we‚Äôre truly interested in. And this paves the way for future stories and Halos.‚Äù So‚Ä¶maybe?

Will Campaign Evolved be a full-price game?

I asked but didn‚Äôt get an answer. Personally, $50 feels right to me without proper multiplayer, but Microsoft already tried to raise its first-party game prices to $80 this year, so I‚Äôm probably being naively optimistic with that $50 thought. At least there‚Äôs new single-player content here, though.

Did you just say ‚Äúnew single-player content‚Äù?

Yes! I didn‚Äôt get any details beyond the very basic description: Campaign Evolved will include a three-mission prequel story arc revolving around Master Chief and Sergeant Johnson. I asked if those missions will be available straight out of the box or if they‚Äôll need to be unlocked, perhaps by completing the campaign. Halo Studios did not have an answer for me.

Are there any gameplay changes?

Yes, lots of little ones, actually. Vehicles are now destructible and they can be hijacked, as they were in every subsequent Halo game after Combat Evolved. You can also now pick up and wield any weapon the enemies can, which means you‚Äôll have access to the Energy Sword, among others, in this campaign. The Warthog has four seats now (the extra one is on the back, like riding on the lowered tailgate of a pickup truck), and you can pilot a Wraith tank. I didn‚Äôt get to see any of the Flood in the chunk of The Silent Cartographer mission I played, but Halo Studios says they‚Äôve implemented dismemberment for Flood enemies. The team also told me that ‚Äúlevel design has been thoughtfully updated‚Äù to smooth out pain points. Presumably they meant the Library, but they didn‚Äôt specify. Also, the cinematics have all been completely redone, with new mocap and freshly rerecorded dialogue from Steve Downes (Master Chief) and Jen Taylor (Cortana).

Any other updates?

One other notable one: Skulls! Halo Studios is adding Skulls to Campaign Evolved, and lots of ‚Äòem. The most Skulls ever in a Halo campaign, apparently, and the total number is ‚Äúdozens.‚Äù

Does it still feel like Halo in Unreal Engine 5?

In my brief experience so far, I‚Äôd say yes. See my preview for more about that.

Halo: Complete Playlist

Halo: Combat Evolved arrived on the scene in 2001. Since then, it's grown beyond the numbered sequels. Log in to manage your backlog and track which games you've completed.

We‚Äôll have much more on Halo: Campaign Evolved as development progresses, so stay tuned! In the meantime, be sure to tune in to our weekly Xbox show, Unlocked, for long-form discussion on everything happening in the world of Xbox.

Ryan McCaffrey is IGN's executive editor of previews and host of both IGN's weekly Xbox show, Podcast Unlocked, as well as our monthly(-ish) interview show, IGN Unfiltered. He's a North Jersey guy, so it's "Taylor ham," not "pork roll." Debate it with him on Twitter at @DMC_Ryan.

item.title: Fortnite x South Park Collab Coming Soon, It‚Äôs Claimed
item.content:encoded:
It has been claimed that a Fortnite collaboration is coming with South Park, the animated show that has been running since the late 1990s. On social media, a claim emerged alongside a source, with the uploader suggesting that someone at Paramount corroborated the leak.

Fans quickly busied themselves imagining how it would work, given that South Park characters are fairly diminutive in stature and stand all of about a few feet tall.

Is South Park Coming to Fortnite?

On social media, SamLeakss claimed that South Park is coming to Fortnite in a crossover event.

Far from being the most unlikely thing in the world, players have accepted that this is gospel and have started assembling theories to explain how the collab would work. One user quickly shared an outfit that might just work:

Others suggested that Epic Games would be throwing Cartman into a Mech Suit, while others demanded the arrival of Mr. Hanky as a Back Bling item. Those familiar with the South Park universe pointed out that ‚Äòanime versions‚Äô of the characters could be used, but that‚Äôs perhaps a little too niche to be a commercial success.

We know nothing beyond the original claim, unfortunately.

In recent Fortnite news, it was revealed that the developers of the Roblox game ‚ÄòSteal a Brainrot‚Äô are trying to sue Fortnite UGC developers who have allegedly ripped off their creation. This is being taken pretty seriously, as Steal a Brainrot has become one of the most popular Roblox games in record time in recent months.

Also, The Simpsons are coming to Fortnite with a themed map.

item.title: 40 Minutes of Wreckreation Gameplay Leaks Online
item.content:encoded:
A recent YouTube video has revealed 40 minutes of gameplay from Wreckreation, the open-world sandbox racer. Eagle-eyed gamers spotted the upload and have been poring over the gameplay, which shows a halfway-decent racer with destruction elements and arcade-like racing mechanics.

Wreckreation is set to drop on October 28, and I‚Äôm hoping for a solid day-one patch, as there are more than a few bugs in the gameplay video uploaded by ‚ÄòFlotutu‚Äô on YouTube.

Burnout in the Big 2025

We‚Äôve not seen a new Burnout game for more than 15 years, which feels pretty harrowing. Once upon a time, Burnout offered a high-octane, energetic racing experience punctuated with visceral crashes and takedown systems.

Wreckreation comes from the creators of the Burnout series, and it‚Äôs an all-new adventure set in a massive open-world map with sandbox mechanics. The game is designed to be pretty open-ended, offering multiplayer gameplay, stacks of customization, and some construction features that allow you to flex your imagination.

Here‚Äôs the video featuring the 40 minutes of Wreckreation gameplay that was uploaded recently:

As the gameplay unravels, prospective fans will spot a few bugs involving the game‚Äôs physics and destruction-based elements. At one point, the player crashes into a truck and glitches inside it, clipping like crazy until the game forces a cutscene.

It‚Äôs relatively safe to assume that a day-one patch will drop on October 28 alongside the launch of the game to address some of these lingering issues. That‚Äôs the problem with playing a game early; it‚Äôs often not representative of the final product.

It looks good enough, though. It‚Äôs mostly unlicensed and focuses more on high-speed, arcade action than realism, but that‚Äôs what people want from former Burnout developers.

Do you think you‚Äôll be investing in Wreckreaction? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Plants Vs. Zombies: Replanted Has Been Updated, Here Are The Full Patch Notes
item.content:encoded:
Another patch is on the way

Plants vs. Zombies: Replanted launched for the Switch and Switch 2 this week, and PopCap has already rolled out some updates. These patches will be arriving on both platforms soon.

First up, is Patch 1.2. Here are all the changes for this patch, including updates to graphics, the Vs Mode, gameplay, audio and more. Here's the full rundown via the Steam game page:

PVZ: Replanted: Launch Day Patch v1.2

Graphical:

  • Fixed Twin Sunflowers faces being too small, they should now fit their petals.
  • Fixed Zomboss‚Äôs eyes to be the correct color relative to his attack.
  • Fixed Split Pea so that they fire with both eyes open.
  • Fixed BrownCoat Zombie‚Äôs retro skin so that arms fall off properly.
  • Fixed Pumpkin to now show the damaged state appropriately.
  • Fixed Dr Zomboss to now have a Health Bar (Nice try Dr Z).
  • Fixed Roof Cleaners flying at the beginning of roof levels
  • Fixed Disco Zombie‚Äôs hair when his head falls off (ouch).
  • Fixed I, Zombie Too to use the correct name.
  • Fixed Pole Vaulter Zombie to drop their actual head on defeat.
  • Fixed Butter not appearing on the retro zombie skin when applied.
  • Fixed Magnetshroom‚Äôs items to layer properly
  • Fixed Retro Zombie to no longer show sunglasses or mustaches on death.

Vs Mode:

  • Jack in the Box, Catapult, and Newspaper zombie now appear in combat.
  • Flower Pot & Planter are no longer selectable in Versus Mode.
  • Sun and Brains no longer block placement in areas around them.

Gameplay:

  • You can now interact with the seed selector to cancel placement instead of needing to click off of the seed selector first.
  • Extra lawnmowers will no longer spawn in Vasebreaker.
  • Ice Trap positioning has been corrected for both Bungie Zombie and Gargantuar.
  • In Co-Op both players can no longer select the same seed packet at the same time

Audio:

  • Turbo Speed will no longer speed up the OST.
  • Shop now plays the correct music regardless of player origination.
  • Pausing the game now correctly pauses the Audio.
  • Invalid placement warning in Versus mode now plays the proper sound effect.
  • Doomshroom & Jalapeno now use the correct sound when destroying tombstones.

Miscellaneous:

  • Several fixes to various assets when in High Contrast Mode
  • Several UI fixes related to missing or misplaced assets
  • Several bugs squashed related to UX due to resolution/control scheme adjustments.

Along with this, PopCap has announced it's already working on Patch 1.2.1. This will be going live within the next few weeks and details about this patch will be revealed in the future.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Battle Royale RedSec Will Have Duos and Squads at Launch, It‚Äôs Claimed
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 RedSec Battle Royale will only be available in Duos and Squads at launch, one insider claims. Once known as Firestorm, we reported that it has changed its name to RedSec and will be shadow dropping on October 28th. 

Now, another story has emerged that may confirm a pretty interesting addition to the mode. While nothing is yet confirmed, the leaker in question has leaked many details about the upcoming mode, including the name and mode itself.

Duos and Squads Are Only Team Options for Battlefield 6 RedSec, Claims Insider

In a post from ModernWarzone, which we reported on yesterday for the name RedSec, they claim that Battlefield 6‚Äôs battle royale mode will only be available in Duos and Squads. That means only groups of two and groups of four will be the only formations playable. Fortunately, the insider claims it will only be for launch, so future builds may expand that number. As they point out, the 100 player count could be made of 50 teams of two and/or 25 teams of four.

With 100 players, it‚Äôs sure to be quite the spectacle. The popularity of EA‚Äôs military shooter has only grown since its release earlier in October. While the surprise shadow drop isn‚Äôt going to be exactly how they may have planned it, it‚Äôs no doubt going to hit big. Other titles like Fortnite and Call of Duty have done the genre, so it‚Äôs natural that Battlefield is going there. Still, it may be a bit disappointing for some who wish to go in by themselves or with a group of five or more.

item.title: Break open a dead MMO and find what goofs and horrors await in Gorgon's Garden
item.content:encoded:
MMOs are a strange facilitation of games because they are, ostensibly, dead on arrival. Not dead in the sense of "lol dead game," that exact comment you see littered in the comments of articles, videos etc. about literally any online game, no matter how popular it is. Dead in the sense that it will die, as all things do, because one day the servers will go down and there will be no (legal) way to play it anymore. I put the legal in brackets there because there are many a fan effort that allow you to play a range of "officially" dead MMOs, but what would a game about a Frankensteinian revival of such a thing look like? Probably, Gorgon's Garden.

For Gorgon's Garden, we go back to the year 2008, weirdly, personally, probably the last year I spent regular amounts of my time playing an MMO. It's a random summer day, and you are trawling through Hypogeum.net, a resuscitated version of it anyway, a fictitious forum all about an MMO called Gorgon's Garden, now defunct due to a majority of the game being sealed away by a digital currency that no longer exists.

In practicality, the game is not the game, "Gorgon's Garden," but the game, Gorgon's Garden. It is you, hanging out on your computer, in what looks to be the family computer room - you can see the edges of the computer screen, hints at a room beyond the bevels fully revealed in a reflection when the screen goes dark. You can browse that fake forum, read cringey posts from people of all ages, learning tidbits about their lives, and importantly, find a tool from a notorious hacker that bypasses that dead digital currency. The world of Gorgon's Garden opens up to you once more.

It's mostly quite simple, you can only look left or right, though you can move in any direction. Attacks are limited to the swing of a sword and one spell, and as you kill enemies you level up, which doesn't do much but increase your health.

As you delve further and further into the game, or perhaps dive is the right word, it starts to fall apart, the forum acting as a hub of secrets pushing you further down the rabbit hole. What starts as something silly moves towards something genuinely a bit unsettling, and I'll stop there because the whole thing is short, and free, and given the season, you've not got much reason to not try it out yourself.

If you need further convincing, Gordon's Garden comes in part from Feverdream Johnny, developer of one of my favourite weirdo platformers Orbo's Odyssey. Go on, give it a go, remind yourself of the horrors of niche forums and your favourite dead MMO, there's no better time for it. You can pick it up on Itch.io.

item.title: Bushido Consequences Cycle Deck Exclusive Preview
item.content:encoded:
Just like the seasons, everything changes in the Jwar Isles. These developments are reflected in the Cycle Decks, and we've been given a first look at some of the cards in the next. In this article, we'll exclusively reveal 5 new cards from the Bushido Consequences Cycle Deck, which is available to preorder now.

We've been covering Bushido for years, so if you'd like to learn more about the game, check out our guide to Bushido Risen Sun, our review of the Bushido Risen Sun 2-player starter set, and our "Start Collecting" guide to Bushido, which includes an interview with the game's developer. You can also check out our review of the last Cycle Deck here.

Seasonal Changes

Cycle Decks in Bushido are a way for GCT to easily incorporate new cards, rather than packaging them with specific miniature releases. The Concequences Cycle Deck, like the Weeping Sky Cycle Deck before it, contains 54 cards for a mixture of factions and card types, including:

  • Events, usually actions that can be played during the game
  • Terrain, which can be deployed onto the battlefield for specific effects
  • Enhancements, are attached to units to offer effects and abilities
  • Themes, offer new abilities if the warband construction restrictions are followed

We don't know the full breakdown yet, but there are usually a few faction-specific cards, along with Ronin cards that can be used by all. GCT has stated that the newest factions, such as Awoken, will receive dedicated cards in upcoming releases like Kuna, rather than in this cycle deck. This allows them to focus on fully developing these factions, however, Awoken players can still incorporate Ronin cycle cards into their warbands.

Below we reveal 5 cards from the new cycle deck, with comments on their design and lore from the GCT Studios team ahead of our own thoughts.

New Eagle Army

Amidst the mystical upheaval in the celestial realm, it's vital to anchor the narrative through the eyes of the Jwar Isles' people. The Shiho Clan has been quietly rebuilding its power base since Hiroto's return. Though they lack the resources to field a standing army like the Prefecture of Ryu, they‚Äôve uncovered pockets of Ashigaru veterans, disciplined fighters whose loyalty, training and battlefield organisation remain intact. These seasoned warriors are well-suited to open combat, a necessity if the Shiho are to reclaim their former influence.

Theme cards play a pivotal role in shaping a faction‚Äôs identity, unlocking fresh warband configurations and tactical possibilities. The New Eagle Army theme exemplifies this. Reflecting the elite band of Shiho Ashigaru, once the envy of the land, these soldiers gain powerful advantages when managing Virtue Tokens, making them reliable in both melee and ranged engagements.

Strategically, the Theme enhances warband efficiency by offering free Warband Terrain  and / or Enhancements, along with cost reductions for Ashigaru profiles. While the Theme forges the Shiho‚Äôs hallmark flanking warfare, it introduces a compelling ‚Äútake and hold‚Äù playstyle, rich with nuanced micro-movements that the faction is celebrated for.

As a Shiho player, I'm looking forward to trying this out. Even as a Wolf player, it reduces the cost of the Wolf Ryoshi and Spears, and adds in the free Terrain and Enhancements. It might just pull me away from my Open Rebellion theme!

Consequences of Kiyohara

Sojobo‚Äôs machinations continue to unfold, and the stakes have never been higher. Having already fractured an Asura, the act that drew the gaze and anger of Rajin, he has now unleashed the Awoken to keep the heavens turning, but at what cost? One thing is clear: desperate times demand desperate measures.

From a gameplay perspective, Sojobo has fallen out of favour with the Kami and is now relentlessly struck by lightning, a punishment few could endure. Even a king, it seems, is not immune to the consequences of his actions.

So why include the card in your warband? Despite the divine backlash, Sojobo's card offers a substantial cost discount, making him a compelling choice. This allows players to field a high-value defender at a low cost, unlocking new possibilities for list-building and tactical flexibility. It‚Äôs a risky play, but one that could pay off handsomely for those bold enough to use it.

Sojobo is a 24-cost Ronin that can join Shiho Clan, Temple of Ro-Kan, and The Descension warbands and is a very effective fighter who can make it harder for ranged attacks across the entire battlefield, and also push units away from them. As the team says above, reducing their cost to 19 at the risk of them taking damage each turn could really pay off.

Yokai Corruption

After the great Tsunami, rising waters forced the spiders from their hidden lairs into human settlements and forests, spreading dread wherever they crept. Once again, the common folk came to fear the spider‚Äôs presence and so Grandmother, and her corrupted followers, took on this form, one that mirrors her essence and the spirit of her death-bringing cycle.

Now, Sojobo must confront the embodiment of the returned Thirteenth Cycle. If he is to fulfill his mission, he cannot avoid this malevolent force. With such powers unleashed, even the Yokai are being reshaped and twisted into new forms that reflect the corruption of nature itself. The Cult of Yueri stands as a chilling benefactor to this transformation.

This card presents a true conundrum. Your Yokai will blaze with additional Ki Tokens, surging with unnatural energy throughout the game. But this power comes at a price: the stolen energies will eventually consume them. It‚Äôs a classic twist on risk-reward mechanics, and one that many Yueri players will find irresistible, offering bold new strategies for those willing to gamble with fate.

Adding this to a Yokai unit with a high Ki empowers them more and means they'll survive longer, but each time they use a Ki feat, they'll drop by 1, which means they might not be as effective late game, but if you want to storm them into combat, and watch them burn out taking down enemies, then this Enhancement for the Cult of Yurei is glorious.

Bleeding Moon‚Äôs Influence

Each cycle is marked by a celestial Asura, a divine embodiment of that cycle‚Äôs spirit and nature. For generations, it was believed there were only twelve cycles, but ancient calendars and forgotten dates revealed a hidden truth: a missing cycle, long obscured, whose absence caused the Heavenly misalignment that Sojobo now seeks to correct. 

With the return of the Thirteenth Cycle, a much older cosmic order begins to reassert itself. At this pivotal moment, Master Bat‚Äôs influence surges, and as the heavens realign with his domain, his growing power manifests through this event card.

Mechanically, this event disrupts many effects that would normally remove Bleeding Markers, including Heal. As a result, any model with the Bleed Trait becomes significantly more lethal, its damage lingering. Ideal for warbands that lean into damage-over-time mechanics.

With the recent release of the Master Bat Ronin unit (who gives Bleed tokens on their attacks) and Nagato, who opened up the House Bleeding Moon Shadow Wind Clan theme, this Event means that those Bleed tokens are definitely going to be there in the end turn to do damage.

Weeping Sky‚Äôs Influence

The skies themselves are said to weep, mourning the faltering celestial order. As the heavens tremble, the consequences ripple through both the mortal realm and the spiritual plane, reshaping the balance of power across the Jwar Isles.

At the heart of this upheaval stands Lord Toad, master of the previous cycle and a divine force whose influence endures. Even King Sojobo, no stranger to ambition, offers him respect. Lord Toad is far from finished. He revels in the bounty his cycle has unleashed, and the signs of his lingering power are unmistakable.

From the quagmire and shadowed tunnels, the lifeless legions of the Imperial Court have begun to rise. Their emergence is no coincidence, it is a reaction to Lord Toad‚Äôs enduring will for change. 

This card offers a powerful early-game advantage: it prevents long-range attacks during Turn One, shielding your warband from opportunistic enemy volleys before formations are set. Whether you're protecting fragile units or setting up a bold advance, this effect can dramatically shift the tempo of the opening round.

The battlefield even becomes a quagmire, Lord Toad, ever the opportunist, thrives in this environment. The movement boost granted by the Quagmire effect plays perfectly into his slippery tactics, allowing him to reposition with ease.

Lord Toad was a recent Ronin release that can be used across all 14 factions. While in a quagmire, Lord Toad's movement is boosted by 2 to 6 and ignores all terrain and other models for the purposes of movement, rushing them ahead to make use of their Swallow Up ki feat to remove an enemy unit from the battlefield for a turn.

Future Consequences

Have any of the above cards piqued your interest? Or what are you hoping for out of the other 49 cards in the Consequences Cycle Deck? Let us know in the comments below.

The Bushido Consequences Cycle Deck is available to preorder along with 13 miniatures in the latest of a huge wave of releases from GCT. I'm picking up Somabo and Kizo from this wave, for an awesome bird invasion of the Jwar Isles!

The preview cards for the Bushido Consequences Cycle Deck used to produce this preview were provided by GCT Studios.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Steam Player Count Spikes With New Mode
item.content:encoded:
A new mode for Marvel Rivals has caused a major player spike on Steam, its highest in a while.

Released in December 2024, the free-to-play multiplayer superhero shooter has been going steady. With the release of Season 4, which added Daredevil and Angela, the game has seen a decent, stable player base. While not as high as when its first season dropped, touting a 644,269 player count, it still ranks as one of the most popular games on Steam. In any case, earlier this week, the numbers rose quite a bit, heading into numbers only seen for the beginning of a season. Well, a new mode, one fans have been asking for for quite a while, has been added.

New PvE Marvel Zombies Mode Almost Doubles Marvel Rivals‚Äô Usual Player Count

According to SteamDB, earlier this week, Marvel Rivals kept at a usual 75k-80k player count, decreasing from the start of Season 4.5 with Daredevil. However, on October 23rd, the game spiked into the high 120k, almost double what it was the previous day. It continued into yesterday and today. The reason? The addition of the Marvel Zombies PvE mode lets players fight against AI enemies. Based on the comic and new animated series, the limited-time Halloween-based mode brings it to life with droves of zombies and perilous fights with friends.

A quick look at Reddit supports the rise quite well, as many fans have praised the mode a ton. Some, like Living-Ad102, want it to be a permanent addition to the game. Given that PvE has been asked for since the game‚Äôs release, the massive spike isn‚Äôt too surprising. If anything, it‚Äôs clear that NetEase may want to do more of these events. Either way, if you want in on the fun, best to do it before mid-November while Marvel Zombies lasts.

Have you played the Marvel Zombies mode in Marvel Rivals yet? If so, how is it? Would you like to see PvE added permanently to the base game? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Marvel Rivals, check out our articles on the upcoming cross-progression addition and Season 5 details. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Old School RuneScape is getting its first new skill since it launched, and so the XP grind begins anew
item.content:encoded:
A thing I find a lot of joy in is the fact that despite there's technically a new, shinier, perhaps by some people's standards better version of it, Old School RuneScape is still kicking around. Before the Old School was tagged on the front end of it, RuneScape was an MMO I put many hours into (and found little success in) as a youth with too much free time, so the fact practically two decades later it's introducing a brand new skill into the game simultaneously impresses me and strikes existential fear into my heart because of how old this game actually is.

Moving on swiftly, sailing! That's the new skill coming to Old School RuneScape, the first new one since its launch. According to a blog post, sailing is quite the undertaking, described as "bigger and more expansive than any content that's come before it," and a skill that "touches almost every aspect of the game." With this new skill, you can own up to five boats at any time. These boats are upgradable, and there's three sizes to choose from: the raft, small boat, and large boat.

There's ship combat, which apparently mostly works the same as land combat, and you can also take a few different NPCs with you out on the sea - or your real friends too! Levelling up requires, technically, just one thing, which is, well, sailing. This includes "interacting with facilities on your boat" like trimming your sails, an action that nets you some XP as well as a speed boost.

On top of all that, you can salvage shipwrecks, chart the oceans you travel across, do some deep sea trawling, complete new quests, gather new resources, and while this one's a bit more secretive, there's new areas to explore too, including 30 new islands, some of which have some new dungeons.

The sailing update is coming to Old School RuneScape pretty soon too, as it's currently planned to launch in just under a month's time on November 19th.

What is NYT Connections?

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it‚Äôs easy to see why. Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It‚Äôs relatively simple, and that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. item.title: Switch 2 Elden Ring Tarnished Edition delayed to 2026 to "allow time for performance adjustments"
item.content:encoded:
FromSoftware has pushed back the release of the highly anticipated Nintendo Switch 2 port of Elden Ring to "allow time for performance adjustments".

In a brief statement, the developer apologised for the delay, but said it was "wholeheartedly [working] toward release", which is now expected sometime in 2026. Sadly, a firmer release window has not been provided.

Elden Ring's Switch 2 port, Tarnished Edition, was announced at a Nintendo Direct presentation back in April. It's slated to include the base game and its Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, as well as new armour and a new Torrent appearance customisation feature.

While development on #ELDENRING Tarnished Edition continues wholeheartedly toward release, we have decided to move the launch to 2026 to allow time for performance adjustments.

We apologize to players looking forward to the game and thank you for your patience and support. pic.twitter.com/TsLrhAWIGc

‚Äî ELDEN RING (@ELDENRING) October 23, 2025

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

FromSoft hadn't given a firm release date for the Switch 2 Tarnished Edition in 2025, but it was initially expected to release before the end of the year.

"We apologise to players looking forward to the game and thank you for your patience and support," the team said.

As for FromSoftware's Elden Ring spin-off, Elden Ring Nightreign? New mode Deep of Night mode is now live, adding extra challenge to the multiplayer spin-off game. The world of Limveld will be full of deadlier enemies, and Nightlords won't be selectable, as in the main game, but instead players can traverse multiple depths, with escalating difficulty and challenges.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone's focus on the year ahead is Battle Royale, Resurgence, and "the future of the game"
item.content:encoded:
"Battle Royale is the foundation upon which we've built every new mode, feature, and memorable moment."

Raven Software says its focus for the year ahead and Call of Duty: Warzone comes down to three pillars: "Battle Royale, Resurgence, and the future of the game".

In a new update posted earlier today, the developer said the team was "incredibly excited and there is much more to come", including a "first look" at some of the updates on the way, but insisted "Battle Royale is the foundation upon which we've built every new mode, feature, and memorable moment".

"While we continue to innovate across the entire game, we feel it's important that Battle Royale remains a cornerstone of what we do," the developer stated. "That's why we're expanding Battle Royale to include support for multiple large maps via map rotation. While it wasn't previously realistic for us to host multiple large maps, we've since taken the steps necessary to support it. This won't be a launch feature with Black Ops 7, but it's a key addition slated for early next year."

Though it previously insisted it would "approach change more deliberately to preserve the original Warzone launch experience" after re-releasing Verdansk last spring, Raven confirmed it's going to "increase how often we release updates and refine the way we surface new features to you".

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

"The goal is balance: keep things moving without forgetting about seasonal support and quality-of-life improvements," the team explained.

As part of that, Raven says it's heard you "loud and clear" about Rebirth Island and the broader Resurgence experience, admitting it has "started to feel a bit stale".

"So, to start, we're delivering a full refresh to Rebirth Island in Season 02, which includes new POI updates, a cosmetic pass, and several other upgrades that improve flow," Raven explained. "The launch of the new Haven's Hollow map in Season 01 will be another step in spicing up Resurgence. These past months, we've made changes based on feedback received during early previews of Haven's Hollow.

"Shortly after launch, we'll be bringing back map rotation to Resurgence, which will swap between Rebirth Island and Haven's Hollow," the statement added. "We are also exploring opportunities to bring back past maps in future seasons: an improved version of Fortune's Keep is underway as we speak. Our goal is to ensure that each map has room to shine without sidelining the ones that you love most."

Moving forward, the developer says it will continue to make "significant, meaningful improvements on multiple fronts", and intends to "deliver a higher frequency of updates, with a larger emphasis on balance changes no less than twice per season".

"Our approach to weapon and attachment balance is fundamentally shifting, which means redefined roles at launch followed by multiple balance passes per season with adjustments entirely unique to Warzone," Raven explained. "Regular updates will extend beyond weapons to include shifts in ground loot, perks, equipment, contracts, and much more throughout the year."

Players can expect a seasonal roadmap next month, and more Ranked Play camos in Season 2, as well as "the arrival of our new Blackout experience on Avalon during Season 2".

Battlefield 6's battle royale mode, rumoured to be called Battlefield: RedSec, could be shadowdropped as soon as next week, according to dataminers.

item.title: Nivalis catches yet another delay, this time into 2026, but it sounds like it's for fair reasons
item.content:encoded:
This is the game's second delay

There are two sides to every game delay coin. On the one hand, it's a shame when you're looking forward to a thing only to have to wait even longer for said thing. On the other, there's too many damn video games these days and, oh, gods, don't we all just have a laundry list of things to attend to right now? So make of it what you will that Nivalis, the cyberpunk restaurant sim set in the world of Cloudpunk, has been delayed.

Word of said delay (its second one) comes in the form of a recent Steam news post, which took the time to highlight just how big this technically small indie game actually is: "Right now, we‚Äôre deeply focused on the voice over: we‚Äôve just completed the casting process for over 100 new voice roles after our first casting of 32 roles for our demo 2 years ago," the post explains. "In Nivalis, there will be around 135 primary and secondary fully voiced characters, for a total of about 200,000 words."

That, to be clear, is genuinely very impressive. We all know how even the biggest of RPGs reuse voice actors for multiple characters and NPCs. With that, the post notes that amongst all of this voice acting stuff, "releasing the game in 2025 would risk compromising its quality." So the game will now be releasing in 2026, though an exact release day or even month hasn't been revealed just yet (apparently the devs are working on this with their publisher, and confirmation of a release date will hopefully be coming before the year is out).

Nivalis, for those that haven't heard of it, conceptually feels like quite an open game. You can manage a restaurant or a night club, buy or grow your own ingredients for your establishment, go fishing, purchase a home, and most importantly meet people. It's the meeting people that almost seems to be the key thing here, and the thing I'm most curious about.

The game's Steam page does note that Nivalis is not an easy city to live in, with gangs hoping to harvest your organs, Corps fining you just for breathing, and "the whole time, the ground under your feet is crumbling." So in a world like this, what are its people like? With as many voice lines as the devs claim the game has, hopefully these people are varied and strongly defined, but I also want them to be people with believable problems, wants, and needs.

Like many of us in this world I worked in hospitality for many years, and met all sorts of folks, which sometimes was even quite a nice thing to do. It was also often not a nice thing to do, a dichotomy I hope is represented in Nivalis, whenever it launches next year. You can wishlist it on Steam here.

item.title: The Paranormal Activity games gets a slightly new name and a scarily underwhelming first gameplay trailer
item.content:encoded:
Might wanna pause that recording

You know, with the original Paranormal Activity steadily approaching two decades of existence, it's becoming harder and harder to recognise what it actually was and is as opposed to the cultural consensus around it. First and foremost you probably think of it as a cheap, jump-scare-filled kind of horror movie, when in actuality the first entry in the series is a slow, tense window into the world of gaslighting and, obviously, the paranormal. Being as removed as we are from this means one thing: IP expansion, which we're viewing today in the form of the first proper trailer for Paranormal Activity: Threshold, the video game adaptation from the developer behind The Mortuary Assistant.

Let's set the scene, with some assistance from the game's description on Steam. Paranormal Activity: Threshold focuses on Daniel and Jessica Stewart, who've just decided to remodel their first home. We're introduced to said home by Daniel, showing a fairly sized if sparsely decorated building that he describes as the only one they could afford. Sure thing Daniel!

The rest of the trailer shows a variety of hauntings and happenings like a shadow moving across the room, a stool sliding along the floor, a door suddenly shutting. There's some kind of vaguely satanic-looking puzzle you can do, but aside from that it doesn't really show much of the broader activities you'll be participating in.

Returning to Steam again, there's an explanation that you can "play in multiple timelines," "hunt and communicate with entities," and "perform demonic rituals to alter your fate." There's apparently multiple endings, and the game's "Paranormal Engine makes every playthrough unique." My guess is that different playthroughs can have different hauntings as I described above take place randomly, which if I'm right, sounds quite similar to the hauntings you can experience in Silent Hill 4's pseudo-hub area.

I'll admit that I feel quite apprehensive about Paranormal Activity getting a game adaptation. I can count the number of good entries in the film series on one hand, but there's two hands worth of films to count, distorting what it could be if done well. How might a game adaptation deal with such a framework? Is a game even capable of capturing that tactile feel an actual tape presents like in the first film, having you question what's real and what isn't? I'm not sure that there's enough filters in the world to convey such a feeling.

In any case, there's no release date for Paranormal Activity: Threshold, but you can wishlist it on Steam in the meantime.

Battlefield 6's battle royale mode could release as soon as next week.

Parts of Battlefield 6's Battle Royale map - complete with all its points of interest (POIs), big and small - leaked over the summer, but now a new content drop discovered by dataminers is also set to shadowdrop alongside Season One on 28th October. According to the leak, this content is codenamed "Granite" and "is NOT Season One" content we already know about.

Neither EA nor Battlefield Studios has yet committed to a release date for the highly anticipated mode, but the teams did previously say that preparation for the shooter's seasonal content would be "starting" with "an exciting new Battlefield take on Battle Royale", suggesting we'll get it sooner rather than later.

EXCLUSIVE: The F2P Battlefield 6 battle royale is officially named ‚ÄúBattlefield: RedSec‚Äù.

item.title: After EA's buyout and creator exodus, The Sims team wants you to know their "values and commitment remain the same"
item.content:encoded:
"The Sims will always be a space where you can express your authentic self."

Last month, something a bit surprising, and perhaps concerning, took place in the games industry: a deal was made which saw that a mixture of Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, equity firm Silver Lake, and Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner's Affinity Partners had privately acquired EA. There's a whole host of reasons why this is worrisome, but one reason in particular is the way that it might affect The Sims.

While it isn't exactly a paragon of identity politics, The Sims has by and large been a game that welcomes and encourages people of all creeds, notably LGBTQIA+ folks. It is probably safe to assume that these new owners, however, will not be so welcoming. In fact, concern has been so great over this acquisition that the biggest Sims YouTuber around lilsimsie has left EA's Creator Network, having been joined by other big Sims YouTubers like Plumbella and James Turner.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

In turn, a message has now been shared by The Sims team on its official Dwitter account seemingly attempting to assuage some of the above concerns, though it has been delivered in a bit of a vague tone. "We're continually inspired by our incredible players and creators; by your imagination, creativity, and the joy you bring to The Sims every day," reads the statement.

"We deeply respect that everyone experiences The Sims in their own way and will make choices that are right for them. However you choose to play, create, or share, we‚Äôre grateful to be part of your journey. Our mission, values, and commitment remain the same. The Sims will always be a space where you can express your authentic self."

The statement carries on with an even vaguer bit about how everyone's "passion and voices" have affected bits to come in 2026, and that on November 4th there'll be a new update coming to The Sims with "150+ fixes and fresh freebies." Notably, this update is "the first of ongoing updates that address the things that matter most to you," though personally this feels slightly disconnected from the main message and is more addressed at those who are frustrated with how broken the game often can be.

This is all well and good for now, it's just still a bit too early to tell what kind of effects this acquisition will have. For now let's all just cross our fingers for the future of any staff members currently working at EA.
